sec.div: Collection of Plant material and extraction of essential oil
sec.p: Plant material of Coccinia grandis was collected from Eklagna village Jalgaon. [20° 58′ 54.3″ N, 075° 27′ 09.5′ E (elevation: 199m)] Maharashtra, identified at Botanical Survey of India, Pune and a specimen voucher number MSMI-1 was deposited in the School of Life Sciences, North Maharashtra University Jalgaon. The collected fresh leaves were cut in to small pieces and extraction was done using Clevenger apparatus for 6h ( Singh et al. 2008). The extracted essential oil was subjected to dryness over anhydrous sodium sulfate (Na 2SO 4) to remove traces of moisture. The physical characteristics of extracted essential oil were recorded, percentage average yield was calculated and it was stored at 4 °C in amber-colored bottle in refrigerator until further analysis.
